detailedRequirements:
Welcome to the Engrafa CrowdReason All Modules Bug Hunt Challenge

 

Project Overview

The goal of the Engrafa Project is to help client generate structured data from documents with industry-leading accuracy. Our base application leverages third-party platforms and crowdsourcing to extract useful information from document in an automated fashion. Finally the service helps provide the structured data based on the needs of various clients.

At its core, the Engrafa Service has a -

  1. Document Manager - Which helps clients manage their documents for easy use with the Engrafa service and external systems
  2. Workflow Manager - To automate data extraction
  3. Integration Manager - To handle integration with 3rd parties. This works with the Workflow Manager to transform the results into formats external systems will recognize. It also notifies clients of newly available data through web hooks and APIs. It works with another sub-module Middleware to achieve this.

 

Challenge Details

Post registration, provide your github handle. We will add you to the Github repository containing the application.

Each module has its own Deployment Guide. Clone the application locally and use the guide to deploy each module.

You need to test all the modules and log any issues that you discover as Github tickets in Github Issues.

Note that the Document Manager module may require your AWS key to allow you access - DO NOT give your key in the challenge forum.

Use the "Contact Manager" option in the Submit and Review tool for this challenge to provide us with your AWS key. You only need to do this if you plan to test the Document Manager module.

 

Points to Note

  • Before you log your issue, ensure that there is no similar issue already logged in. You can do a quick keyword search and only when you are sure that there is no other ticket logged for the same issue, create one.
  • Simple issues related to spelling and grammar may not count.
  • Issues must be clearly described. Provide a test case (perhaps an unlisted video reproducing the issue or a document with steps on how to reproduce the issue) along with the expected vs actual results in order for your issue to be counted.
  • Video / screenshots in your issue description will help tremendously.
  • If an issue is not properly documented, we may reject it and it will not count.
  • If you submit an issue that is seen in multiple screens as multiple issues, they will only count as one. Others will be maked as duplicate.
  • The first participant to find an issue gets the credit - duplicate issues will not be counted.
  • Only create issues until the submission phase. After that, any issue logged will not count.
  • We will mark the issue as accepted, rejected or duplicate.
  • Participant with the most number of accepted issues wins this Bug Hunt
  • Participants who do not win the Bug Hunt but submit issues that were not covered by the participant placed first will receive an additional $10 per issue. However, the total amount paid in such a scenario will not exceed the amount of the participant placed first.

 

Read more about the Bug Hunt challenge and the Issue Report template here - 

Bug Hunt - How to: http://apps.topcoder.com/wiki/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=35691122

Issue Report Template: http://apps.topcoder.com/wiki/display/tc/Bug+Hunt+Competitions+-+Issue+Report+Template
finalSubmissionGuidelines:
Refer to the "Points to Note" section.

You need report your issues in Github Issues. Please submit a text file contains the bugs you reported to OR.
